text:
169-163 Bowery, east side, south of Delancey Street, showing Miner's Bowery Theatre, (165-167) which was known around 1920, as the Royal Theatre. Also seen is the Third Ave., Elevated Lines.

About 1890.

International News Photos.

The theatre after falling into disrepair was demolished around 1934 and has been replaced by a business structure since. The New York Sun of May 6, 1938, in a list of demolitions reports that the 5-story building (No. 163) adjoining same on the right, is to have its complete front altered.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Delancey Street

text:
(1)
Bowery, east side, north from but not including Delancey Street. The view shows the People's Theatre, 199 Bowery.
May 5, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a closer view of the Theatre Front.
October 12, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, a further view northward and showing two 2-story frame buildings at Nos. 203-205 Bowery, east side, south of Rivington Street.
October 12, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

text:
The Bowery and Environs (midground from right to left) north from Delancey Street (left) as viewed northwestward from the former Libbys Hotel. The photographer is viewing across Rivington to Prince Streets. The Salvation Army Memorial Hotel is on the east side of the Bowery and to the north of Rivington Street.

February 14, 1930.
Views 1 and 2

P.L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Delancey Street

title: Manhattan: Bowery - Delancey Street

text:
The Bowery (Third Avenue "El" thereon), at Delancey Street (foreground, and which becomes Kenmare Street after crossing the Bowery) as viewed southwestward from the subsequently razed Libbys Hotel. Note the Woolworth Bldg. outline at the left and the New York Telephone Bldg. at the right. Beneath the latter appears the dome of the Central office of the New York Police Department. This area, a portion of the old Bayard Farm, is to the north of Chinatown and is a densely ghetto district, being populated mainly by individuals of Italian extraction.

February 14, 1930

P.L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Delancey Street

text:
Bowery, east side, north from Delancey Street.
May 5, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
